intro: Podolepis gnaphalioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
